comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: The site looks great and it's faster enough. I think your site has launched long ago but new in bitcointalk. Correct me if I'm wrong. I just had a look and it seems there are a lot of high rollers on the site. Are they real?Also, which set of cryptocurrencies do you accept? I haven’t seen any info.

comments.author: slotella
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on July 04, 2022, 04:06:20 AMThe site looks great and it's faster enough. I think your site has launched long ago but new in bitcointalk. Correct me if I'm wrong. I just had a look and it seems there are a lot of high rollers on the site. Are they real?Also, which set of cryptocurrencies do you accept? I haven’t seen any info.Thank you for your generous feedback! Our team cares about player feedbacks! We are new in Bitcointalk and started our journey a few weeks ago and planning a long journey in the industry.We currently support deposits and withdrawals with these cryptos:In addition, we continue to work on credit card and skrill, neteller options.Please feel free to share your problems and feedback with us. Unlike other casinos, we can develop our system quickly.

comments.author: slotella
comments.body: Quote from: AbuBhakar on July 04, 2022, 04:52:02 AMWelcome to the forum and hoping for your success. I just notice that you have a lot of whale player already judging the last bet history which a lot of players winning more than 100K EURO per bet.I just want to ask if there’s a KYC for a large deposit and withdrawal? This is the common concern by the forum user and I don’t see answer regarding this matter on your ToS. It will be cool too if you will a promotion and giveaway here to try your website.Thank you AbuBhakar! We dont currently bore our users with KYC, except for major suspicious activities. We are in the Crypto industry, we are aware of the privacy and other habits of our players.

comments.author: $crypto$
comments.body: Welcome to the forum.At the moment I'm using mobile it looks pretty good and a little elegant that I see, maybe the PC version will be interesting again, once I get back home I'll try to register for the casino and see how it goes.But is there a welcome bonus for the forum, but not a welcome bonus?I read the rules there so every withdrawal of 2000 Euros or the equivalent of that crypto requires KYC?I think people prefer not to KYC even though their withdrawal is big.

comments.body: Welcome to the forum, it looks like you really understand how this forum works by directly buying a copper membership so that your image can be seen.Quote from: AbuBhakar on July 04, 2022, 04:52:02 AMI just want to ask if there’s a KYC for a large deposit and withdrawal? This is the common concern by the forum user and I don’t see answer regarding this matter on your ToS. Thank you for good review!Also we think you will really like it in the desktop version.We made an update on this.In fact, our policy on this issue is clear:Slotella doesnt bother its players as much as possible with policies like KYC. We are a casino in the crypto industry, but we require KYC submissions from our users for major suspicious transaction activities.Not every detail in our terms of use has been prepared for a standard player. We only require KYC for major suspicious user activity.

comments.author: OcTradism
comments.body: Quote from: Strongkored on July 04, 2022, 05:09:14 AMI see this on their ToS So if you are a high roller, you may be required to KYC because it is definitely possible to make large withdrawals.Require additional KYC for withdrawal above 2,000 Euro looks bad. I know casino can do it but this value is not too big. I understand that each casino has their own bankroll, big or small so their rules for additional KYC and withdrawal value to trigger it are different.This rule can be a negative one for guests and they might choose another casino that requires additional KYC with higher withdrawal, maybe 10,000 or 20,000 Euro.

comments.author: slotella

We have made an update to our terms and conditions on this issue. Our goals is not to bore our players with formalities.Legally, we only apply such procedures to suspicious players.If you're a regular player you don't have to worry about it

Hopefully this site will bring you something good for gamblers for a long time. And you can bring a signature campaign for the promotion of your casino. There are many good managers in the forum to promote your casino who provide good signature campaign.

comments.author: Bttzed03
comments.body: First impression upon opening the website was that I thought I'm visiting Stake.com  Don't worry about it (it's not an issue/problem).I find the minimum deposit and withdrawal a bit high but other members might have a different opinion. The amounts would have been fair before but there are a number of crypto casinos that have way less requirements now. I'm just saying all these because competition is quite tough in here and you might consider making changes/adjustments.Anyway, welcome and goodluck!Quote4.2. The minimum deposit amounts are as follows:0,00025 BTC0,009 ETH0,020 LTC32 XRP0,09 BCH10 USDT10 USDCQuote5.2. comments.author: $crypto$
comments.body: Quote from: slotella on July 04, 2022, 05:49:41 AMAs we mentioned in the messages above, our regular players dont need to worry about this. We follow the industry and the habits of the players.Ok we now understand that only suspicious accounts will initiate KYC and get asked by the team, but if my account is safe maybe this process will not go through even if the withdrawal is above 2000 euros.But are users using VPN allowed in this casino?I didn't find out from the ToS about using a VPN, whether this was skipped or not I typed a search for the word VPN doesn't exist.

comments.author: slotella
comments.body: Quote from: $crypto$ on July 04, 2022, 06:02:15 AMQuote from: slotella on July 04, 2022, 05:49:41 AMAs we mentioned in the messages above, our regular players dont need to worry about this. We follow the industry and the habits of the players.Ok we now understand that only suspicious accounts will initiate KYC and get asked by the team, but if my account is safe maybe this process will not go through even if the withdrawal is above 2000 euros.But are users using VPN allowed in this casino?I didn't find out from the ToS about using a VPN, whether this was skipped or not I typed a search for the word VPN doesn't exist.Let's be clear If you are not a suspicious player (usually between 5% and 7% of players are identified as suspicious) We can guarantee that we will not ask for KYC on withdrawals.We dont have any restrictions for VPN yet. (except USA and UK) But, some game providers are able to detect the VPN. We dont have the authority for this.

(except USA and UK) But, some game providers are able to detect the VPN. We dont have the authority for this.Fair enough mate , because game provider usually are strict in their regulations about VPN using so lets be clear about this.
